segments.text: I notice the water just pouring out of the sink, and the woman is acting like it’s not even happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is soaked, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the cabinets—they’re getting ruined by all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely clueless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip and fall before she even notices the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really going for it, stretching as far as he can to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the water splashing everywhere, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange mix of calm and chaos in the same room.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt before she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be a mess soon if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR
